summary: Email chain between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding the production of discovery materials in the case US v. Maxwell, specifically concerning non-testifying witness materials. The exchange details the preparation and delivery of hard drives containing sensitive materials, including the 'PBS Education Records' and the 'Epstein Photo Book', which are designated as confidential.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser communicating about the delivery of hard drives containing discovery materials for the defense team and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on emails regarding the discovery production.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on emails regarding the discovery production.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Defense attorney from Cohen & Gresser, copied on emails regarding the discovery production.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on emails regarding the discovery production.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case US v. Maxwell, for whom discovery materials are being produced and delivered to the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

connections.description: Both are attorneys at the law firm Cohen & Gresser, working on the defense team for Ghislaine Maxwell.
Both are defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on the same discovery production emails.
Both are defense attorneys from HMF Law representing Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on the same discovery production emails.
Everdell is part of the legal team providing discovery materials to Maxwell, indicating an attorney-client relationship.
Sternheim is a defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on discovery production emails.

events.title: Discovery Production for Maxwell Case
events.description: Prosecutors confirm that a supplemental production of non-testifying witness materials, including confidential items like the PBS Education Records and Epstein Photo Book, is ready for delivery to the defense and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Hard Drive Delivery Coordination
events.description: Email exchange coordinating the delivery of a 1TB hard drive for Ghislaine Maxwell and a 128GB thumb drive for her attorneys, containing discovery materials.

events.title: Notification of Supplemental Production
events.description: Prosecutors notify defense counsel that a supplemental production of non-testifying witness material is ready, requiring physical drives due to large audio/video file sizes, and discuss new marking protocols for confidential materials.

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
keyFacts: Prosecutors designated the 'PBS Education Records' and the 'Epstein Photo Book' as confidential materials subject to a protective order.
Discovery materials included audio and video files too large for electronic transfer, requiring physical hard drives (1TB for Maxwell, 128GB for attorneys).

The DOJ directed the prosecution to cease using the word 'confidential' on materials to avoid confusion with classified documents, using a specific label referencing protective order paragraphs instead.
The document reveals ongoing discovery production in US v. Maxwell in July 2021, indicating pre-trial evidence sharing.
Multiple defense attorneys from different firms (Cohen & Gresser, HMF Law) were involved in receiving discovery for Ghislaine Maxwell.
